html:
** Affirm Holdings AFRM.O shares down 3.6% at $132.11 after Piper Sandler initiates coverage with 'neutral' rating

** Piper sets PT at $127, well below Street median of $172.50, per Refinitiv data

** Emergence of buy now, pay later (BNPL) lending will continue for next several years due to shift in consumer behavior and AFRM will be a leading player within the industry, Piper analyst Kevin Barker writes in note

** However, the stock is currently pricing in very rapid growth (60%+) for the next several years, he says, and/or an expansion of non-BNPL lending revenue "not apparent within the current construct of the company"

** Baker also starts Synchrony Financial SYF.N at 'neutral', cites increasing credit card delinquency rates and stock's "elevated valuation"

** Now, 8 of 14 analysts covering AFRM rate stock 'buy' or stronger, 5 are neutral and 1 recommends selling - Refinitiv

** AFRM's stock has lost nearly a fifth of its value in Nov. Earlier this month, analysts expressed bullish views on co's exclusive tie-up with Amazon.com AMZN.O (Full Story), and a week later AFRM raised $1.5 bln in an upsized convertible bond deal (Full Story)

** Shares opened at $90.90 in their Jan 13 debut vs $49 IPO price


(Lance Tupper is a Reuters market analyst. The views expressed are his own)

(( lance.tupper@thomsonreuters.com
